Parameters: int: The ID of a virtual child node, if the @B_android#view#View_E@ for this preparer supports virtual descendents, or @B_android#view#accessibility#AccessibilityNodeProvider#HOST_VIEW_ID_E@ if the request is for the view itself.
String: The extra data key for the request
Bundle: The arguments for the request
Message: A message that must be sent to its target when preparations are complete.
onPrepareExtraData(int,java.lang.String,.Description: Callback to allow preparation for filling extra data. Only called back if REQUEST_TYPE_EXTRA_DATA is requested.
onPrepareExtraData(int,java.lang.String,.FullName: public abstract void onPrepareExtraData (int virtualViewId, String extraDataKey, Bundle args, Message preparationFinishedMessage)

Returns: The view this object was created with, or null if the weak reference held to the view is no longer valid.
getView().Description: Get the view this object was created with.

Parameters: View: The view whose requests need preparation. It must be attached to a window. This object will retain a weak reference to this view, and will unregister itself from AccessibilityManager if the view is detached from a window. It will not re-register itself.
int: The types of requests that require preparation. Different types may be ORed together. Value is either 0 or @B_android#view#accessibility#AccessibilityRequestPreparer#REQUEST_TYPE_EXTRA_DATA_E@
Throws: if the view is not attached to a window.

ClassDesc: Object responsible to ensuring that a @B_android#view#View_E@ is prepared to meet a synchronous request for accessibility data. Because accessibility requests arrive to @B_android#view#View_E@s synchronously on the UI thread, a View that requires information from other processes can struggle to meet those requests. Registering an instance of this class with @B_android#view#accessibility#AccessibilityManager_E@ allows a View to be notified when a request is about to be made, and to asynchronously inform the accessibility system when it is ready to meet the request. @B_android#view#View_E@ cannot otherwise synchronously meet the request for accessibility data.
